intro: Phlogacanthus tubiflorus var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phlogacanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
